<jradthebad> So, I thought that GameMode was a super global initialized by the client... I'm trying to set listeners up in a separate script file but I'm getting an error saying that it's trying to reference "GameMode" as a nil value
<jradthebad> I'm assuming this means that it thinks that GameMode is undeclared?
<Perry> yeah
<Perry> GameRules is globally declared
<Perry> not GameMode
<jradthebad> Ah. So if I declare it as say... local GM = GameRules:GetGameModeEntirity() will that work?
<Perry> yes
<Perry> but that is a special entity
<Perry> usually you do GameRules.Addon = GameMode() in Activate()
<jradthebad> Oh baby. That did it. Thanks!
<Perry> so generally you would use GameRules directly, or GameRules.Addon to get your gamemode object
<jradthebad> I'm using a template for the game. I'm assuming that exactly what this line is doing? :
<jradthebad> GameRules.AddonTemplate = CAddonTemplateGameMode()
<Perry> yep
<Perry> so there are a few function in the API that have to be run on CDOTAGameMode
<Perry> for that you use GetGameModeEntity
<Perry> but if you just want to call a function that is part of your game mode you use the GameRules.AddonTemplate one
<jradthebad> Ok. Thanks
<jradthebad> Event listeners appear to always refence "GameMode" so I presume that's a case where I have to reference GameRules.AddonTemplate or GameRules:GetGameModeEntity() ?
<Perry> =api ListenToGameEvent
<Renol> [Global] int ListenToGameEvent( cstring, handle, handle ) -- Register as a listener for a game event from script.
<Perry> that one?
<jradthebad> That's the one. It's global though?
<jradthebad> Oh... I'm confusing myself.
<Perry> yeah, usually what you do is ListenToGameEvent('eventName', Dynamic_Wrap(GameMode, 'functionName'), self)
<Perry> that means it will fire the functionName function from the GameMode class you defined

<Perry> jradthebad, the reason self is not defined in the code you linked is because you define StartAllListeners globally
<Perry> instead of binding it to your GameMode class
<Perry> so instead you should do GameMode:StartAllListeners()
<Perry> and then self will be defined
<Perry> as an instance of GameMode
<Perry> passing GameMode instead of self is an ugly and frankly incorrect hack

if i had to guess
when you rpreface an item with item_ it removes the prefix because

so the game falls back to their default names minus the item_
a la the default for "ability texture" is "ability name"

so they have to remove the item_
a la something something spaghetti

Sarynth 28-Mar-17 03:13 PM
The first barebones is the name of the git repo. The second barebones is the name of the addon, which you can change. The extensive path is for new modders to get a hint of where in the dota 2 beta folder things belong.
I used it for the first couple of test mods as-is, but for the last couple of mods I've started with an empty addon, and pulled in pieces of barebones as needed.
Jake | Arhowk 28-Mar-17 03:18 PM
no
the reason
the folder structure is like that
is because the actual folder structure is /game/addon_name/...
so you have to put an additional folder
the "content" and "game" are just there to signify which path they go to relative
and bmd is kinda wonky
Sarynth 28-Mar-17 03:18 PM
steamapps\common\dota 2 beta\game\dota_addons\boss_beta
Actual path.
Jake | Arhowk 28-Mar-17 03:19 PM
that and bmds shit is.. well... shit
Sarynth 28-Mar-17 03:19 PM
barebones/game/dota_addons/barebones/ git barebones repo
the first barebones is the name of the git repo
the second barebones is the name of the addon
so you can ignore that first barebones/ because that's the github repo name, thus you're left with game/dota_addons/barebones
which I was just saying the extensive path (dota_addons/barebones) is for new moders to know where stuff goes. Personally in my git repos I just make a game and a content folder, and then hardlink them where they need to go.

Sarynth 31-Mar-17 10:49 AM
You are making a vmdl outside your current mod or addon. This is not supported
The two main things that cause this error is if when you save, you use an addon folder that wasn't the addon folder you used to launch tools, or if it is, then symlinks can also confuse the tool if you're using a path that it doesn't think is correct. If you're situation is not one of those, then I'm not sure.
